column1: Conflans-Sainte-Honorine ([kɔ̃.flɑ̃.sɛ̃t‿ɔ.nɔ.ʁin]) is a commune in the Yvelines department in the Île-de-France region in north-central France. It is located in the northwestern suburbs of Paris
column2: 24.2 km (15.0 mi) from the center of Paris.

column1: The commune was originally named for its geographic position at the confluence of the Seine and Oise rivers. The village was given the addition "Sainte Honorine" in the 13th century after the female Saint Honorina
column2: whose relics had been stored there since AD 876.

column1: Partly on account of its strategic position
column2: Conflans-Sainte-Honorine is considered the capital of the French inland waterways
column3: and the right bank of the River Seine is still lined with barges (although these are now used mainly as houseboats). Every year in June
column4: the town celebrates the Pardon national de la batellerie in remembrance of its former importance to inland shipping.

column1: Conflans-Sainte-Honorine is served by Conflans-Sainte-Honorine station on the Transilien Paris – Saint-Lazare regional rail line.
It is also served by Conflans – Fin d'Oise station which is an interchange station on Paris RER line A and on the Transilien Paris – Saint-Lazare suburban rail line.
As of 2016 the city's schools had 4
column2: 258 students. There are nine public preschools
column5: and an école régionale du premier degré (ERPD).Elementary schools:

column3: was killed and beheaded in 2020 in an Islamist terrorist attack.
